scenarioDescription:
The KMT-2019-BLG-1715L Exoplanetary System


Overview

KMT-2019-BLG-1715L is a star with 0.61 times the mass of the Sun, and NaN times its radius. It is located 12589.62 light years away from the solar system.

KMT-2019-BLG-1715L is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the KMT-2019-BLG-1715L system


KMT-2019-BLG-1715L b

KMT-2019-BLG-1715L b was discovered by the KMTNet observatory, in 2021-06, using the microlensing method. Its semi-major axis is 3.32 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of KMT-2019-BLG-1715L b is 814.080 times the mass of Earth. The radius of KMT-2019-BLG-1715L b is 13.200 that of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, KMT-2019-BLG-1715L b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanetary system KMT-2019-BLG-1715L, which contains 1 exoplanets and was discovered by the KMTNet.
name: KMT-2019-BLG-1715L - System With 1 Exoplanet
